newsitem.title: CROATIA: Croatian stocks mixed, traders predict stedy rise.
newsitem.headline: Croatian stocks mixed, traders predict stedy rise.

text.p: Croatian stocks were mixed on Wednesday and traders predicted steady rise of blue chips as the number of share-buyers grows.
"Zagrebacka Banka and Pliva will see a steady growth with more people buying shares instead of saving foreign currency," Marijana Reskovac of Karlovacka Banka told Reuters.
"Hoteliers might boom after the tourist season is over as their prices are pretty low at the moment," she added.
* Of seven active issues three rose, two were flat and one fell.
* Drugs firm Pliva gained 350 kuna to 11,350 trading 275 shares.
* Most active Zagrebacka Banka was up 20 kuna to 670 on volume of 16.049 units.
* Foodprocessor Podravka closed 20 kuna up at 215 kuna and 504 units changed hands.
* Brewerey Karlovacka Pivovara which last traded earlier in the month was up one kuna to 178 and sold 533 shares.
* Both hoteliers that traded stayed unchanged.
- Arenaturist was flat at 100 kuna with 529 shares sold.
- Laguna was also flat at 800 kuna but only 45 shares changed hands.
* Confectioner Kras, the only loser, edged down 5 kuna with 570 units sold.
* Daily volume up at 18,505 shares, turnover also higher at 14,047 kuna.
* Central bank's exchange rate: 5.2918 = $ 1. -- Metka Jelenc, Zagreb Newsroom, 385-1-455075.
